column16: Ballot Comment

For MU3 Immunization Registry reporting, EHRs are already reporting to Immunization Registry with NDC code and CVX code for immunizations administered at the facility, and only CVX code for historical immunizations administered by others. From the Differential Table, the constraint for Immunization.vaccineCode indicates binding to CVX code. 
I think we should follow the same guideline published by CDC to be consistent where we exttract this information.
column17: Should support NDC, not just CVX

Why is support for Immunization.vaccinationProtocol required? Won't the CDS engine receiving the immunization history have to do its own evaluation of the doses against the schedule being used for forecasting? Especially given that in STU4 we are looking to split the protocol into a separate resource (ImmunizationEvaluation), it would seem better not to require support here unless there is a critical reason to require it.
column17: Should support for Immunization.vaccinationProtocol be changed?

column16: Value sets are all examples and very limited. A more extensive set that is required would be much more useful for CDSi than examples only.  And the value sets should be comprehensive to allow appropriate post-hoc analysis (e.g., site administered has only 2 codes)
column17: More extensive set of values would be much more useful

column16: The value set is limited and should include more possibilities. Understood that this value set is an exemplar, but a specific example set should be consistent with requirements for use (and really should be required).  For the EHR, receipt from an IIS is an important source to differentiate another provider as the source - perhaps IIS, other clinician, school-based clinic AND Pharmacy should be part of the value set.
column17: Value set should include more possibilities and should differentiate the different types of sources

column16: The value set should be more useful to a clinician and developed for clinicians and public health. Patient objection and product out of stock are useful. Immunity should actually be addressed by logic in the CDS to identify immunity and that might be according to serologic test results or clinical disease - so these two possibilities should be clearly separated. Medical precaution should also have more granularity - e.g., allergy (to what), prior adverse reaction, etc.
column17: The value set should be increased, patient objection and product out of stock are useful, immunity should be better supported, medical precautions should also have more granularity

column16: The route codes are helpful but not sufficient. (1) they should not be an example, (2) they should not be ambiguous - e.g., oral preparation should have an oral route, SC should have Subcutaneous route, ID should include intradermal route - the value set should be specific to allow administration appropriately and required to assure submission to the registry is aligned with how data are captured in the EHR and data quality can be assured.
column17: The route codes need to be less ambiguous

column16: Consider including newly proposed ODH resource to facilitate using patient's work information for CDS, which fits with user stories.

column16: Would have loved to see these examples!

The profile limits the use of all but two properties. A typical system that uses FHIR will make use of more Patient fields. In order to implement these profiles, the typical system will need to be modified to remove the extra data. I suggest allowing the data to be passed (ex; not constraining fields like "identifier" to 0..0), and requiring (1..1) only gender and birthDate. This will make implementation easier. If this is not possible given the use-case, it should be explained why on the front page, or within the description of the Patient profile itself. I also recommend making birthDate and gender "must support" fields.

While gender and age are the most important properties in determining recommendations for immunizations, the implementation guide does not make it clear that these recommendations are NOT patient-specific. I believe the implementation guide should leave room for the CDS engine to determine more accurately what immunizations a specific patient should be given, based on history and conditions. To identify a specific patient, though, more details will need to be allowed on the Patient profile (see comment #1).
column17: Guide is not clear that recommendations are not patient specific

column16: The profile for ImmunizationRecommendation does not seem to constrain or clarify the generic ImmunizationRecommendation resource. I recommend removing the profile, since and simply referencing the general ImmunizationRecommendation resource.
column17: Recommend removing profile and referencing general resource

column16: CDS Hooks is now the preferred approach for handling CDS Web services.  Please migrate the content over to a CDS Hooks approach.

I don’t think we should have individual resources for CDS recommendations of particular domains.  Otherwise we'll end up with things like ImagingRecommendation resource, LaboratoryObservationRecommendaiton resource, etc.  I think we should use a more generic structure that can then be profiled down for specific domains.
column17: Don't create a new domain-specific resource to define CDS recommendations for specific domains.

column16: The notion of a restricted patient profile is applicable beyond immunization decision support (InfoButton, for example has the same notion of a restricted patient profile). Suggest coordinating with other implementation guides and work groups to apply this notion more broadly (US Core IG, QI Core IG, CDS WG)
column17: Suggest coordinating with others to apply ntion of restricted patient profile more broadly

column16: The implementation guide should take advantage of existing specifications in the decision support space. The CDS Hooks interaction in particular supports everything necessary for the operation described here.
The US Core Implementation Guide defines an Immunization profile. Suggest coordinating this profile with the US Core IG. Is there a reason the US Core profile was not used?
column17: Why was the US Core profile not used?

column16: The QI Core Implementation Guide defines an Immunization profile (derived from the US Core IGs) that is largely the same as the profile defined here. Suggest coordinating this profile with QI Core.
column17: Suggest coordinating this profile with QI core.

column16: The QI Core Implementation Guide defines an ImmunizationRecommendation profile that is largely the same as the profile defined here. Suggest coordinating this profile with QI Core.
column17: Suggest coordinating this profile with QI core.

column16:
Should include: "notGivenReason"
When a vaccine is marked as not given, it is important from clinical perspective to include the reason
(Note - the doseTtatusReason element is specific to the doseStatus element, and does not appear to be applicable to the "notGiven" element [both the doseStatus code and doseStatusReaon code links return a 404 error message at the time of review] and hence information is not available to discern whether it may or may not be relevant]. It is assume that the doseStatusReason is not relevant to the "not Given"element)

The Differential Table for this CDS profile includes only a single data element: "ImmunizationRecommendation" - cardialit = 0..*; but the Terminology Binding section includes 4 data elements: vaccineCode, targetDisease, forecastStatus, dateCriterionCode

Question - are these supposed to be included in this profile?
column17: Terminology buinding includes 4 data elements, are these supposed to be included in this profile?

column16: Should reference "Condition" resource, which is clinically high value to help determine the gravity/weighting of the recommendation

"Several points aligning with the findings of BCBSA and other payers: 
1.) Practitioner and Organization definitions should be updated to include Payer/Insurer 
2.) Level 3 linking to real world concepts in the healthcare system or Administration diagrams must include payer/insurer 
3.) Level 4 objects must reference CareTeam Member Function value set in order to include Payer/Insurer"

column16: Given the use case to tackle clinical decision support for immunizations to be used in health information systems to indicate which vaccinations a patient is due for next, why not use http://hl7.org/fhir/2018Jan/cqif/cqif-cds-on-fhir.html instead of introducing a new CDS immunization forecast FHIR operation
